title: The Roman emperor Didius Julianus is assassinated.
text: The Roman emperor Didius Julianus is assassinated.

title: Zhongdu (now Beijing), then under the control of the Jurchen ruler Emperor Xuanzong of Jin, is captured by the Mongols under Genghis Khan, ending the Battle of Zhongdu.
text: Zhongdu (now Beijing), then under the control of the Jurchen ruler Emperor Xuanzong of Jin, is captured by the Mongols under Genghis Khan, ending the Battle of Zhongdu.

title: Alfonso X is proclaimed king of Castile and León.
text: Alfonso X is proclaimed king of Castile and León.

title: Residents of Riga and Grand Duchy of Lithuania defeated the Livonian Order in the Battle of Turaida.
text: Residents of Riga and Grand Duchy of Lithuania defeated the Livonian Order in the Battle of Turaida.

title: A monk, John Cor, records the first known batch of Scotch whisky.
text: A monk, John Cor, records the first known batch of Scotch whisky.

title: Anne Boleyn is crowned Queen of England.
text: Anne Boleyn is crowned Queen of England.

title: Combined forces loyal to Charles V attack and expel the Ottomans from Tunis during the Conquest of Tunis.
text: Combined forces loyal to Charles V attack and expel the Ottomans from Tunis during the Conquest of Tunis.

title: The Roundheads defeat the Cavaliers at the Battle of Maidstone in the Second English Civil War.
text: The Roundheads defeat the Cavaliers at the Battle of Maidstone in the Second English Civil War.

title: Start of the Sumuroy Revolt: Filipinos in Northern Samar led by Agustin Sumuroy revolt against Spanish colonial authorities.
text: Start of the Sumuroy Revolt: Filipinos in Northern Samar led by Agustin Sumuroy revolt against Spanish colonial authorities.

title: Mary Dyer is hanged for defying a law banning Quakers from the Massachusetts Bay Colony.
text: Mary Dyer is hanged for defying a law banning Quakers from the Massachusetts Bay Colony.

title: In Dover, England, Charles II of England and Louis XIV of France sign the Secret Treaty of Dover, which will force England into the Third Anglo-Dutch War.
text: In Dover, England, Charles II of England and Louis XIV of France sign the Secret Treaty of Dover, which will force England into the Third Anglo-Dutch War.

title: Battle of Öland: allied Danish-Dutch forces defeat the Swedish navy in the Baltic Sea, during the Scanian War (1675–79)
text: Battle of Öland: allied Danish-Dutch forces defeat the Swedish navy in the Baltic Sea, during the Scanian War (1675–79)

title: The Scottish Covenanters defeat John Graham of Claverhouse at the Battle of Drumclog.
text: The Scottish Covenanters defeat John Graham of Claverhouse at the Battle of Drumclog.

title: Wolraad Woltemade rescues 14 sailors at the Cape of Good Hope from the sinking ship De Jonge Thomas by riding his horse into the sea seven times. He drowned on his eighth attempt.
text: Wolraad Woltemade rescues 14 sailors at the Cape of Good Hope from the sinking ship De Jonge Thomas by riding his horse into the sea seven times. He drowned on his eighth attempt.

title: Benedict Arnold, a general in the Continental Army during the American Revolutionary War, is court-martialed for malfeasance.
text: Benedict Arnold, a general in the Continental Army during the American Revolutionary War, is court-martialed for malfeasance.

title: Kentucky is admitted as the 15th state of the United States.
text: Kentucky is admitted as the 15th state of the United States.

title: The battle of the Glorious First of June is fought, the first naval engagement between Britain and France during the French Revolutionary Wars.
text: The battle of the Glorious First of June is fought, the first naval engagement between Britain and France during the French Revolutionary Wars.

title: Tennessee is admitted as the 16th state of the United States.
text: Tennessee is admitted as the 16th state of the United States.

title: War of 1812: U.S. President James Madison asks the Congress to declare war on the United Kingdom.
text: War of 1812: U.S. President James Madison asks the Congress to declare war on the United Kingdom.

title: Capture of USS Chesapeake.
text: Capture of USS Chesapeake.

title: Napoleon promulgates a revised Constitution after it passes a plebiscite.
text: Napoleon promulgates a revised Constitution after it passes a plebiscite.

title: James Clark Ross becomes the first European at the North Magnetic Pole.
text: James Clark Ross becomes the first European at the North Magnetic Pole.

title: Territorial Governor Alexander Ramsey declared the Territory of Minnesota officially established.
text: Territorial Governor Alexander Ramsey declared the Territory of Minnesota officially established.

title: The American adventurer William Walker conquers Nicaragua.
text: The American adventurer William Walker conquers Nicaragua.

title: Charles Baudelaire's Les Fleurs du mal is published.
text: Charles Baudelaire's Les Fleurs du mal is published.

title: American Civil War: The Battle of Fairfax Court House is fought.
text: American Civil War: The Battle of Fairfax Court House is fought.

title: American Civil War: Peninsula Campaign: The Battle of Seven Pines (or the Battle of Fair Oaks) ends inconclusively, with both sides claiming victory.
text: American Civil War: Peninsula Campaign: The Battle of Seven Pines (or the Battle of Fair Oaks) ends inconclusively, with both sides claiming victory.

title: The Treaty of Bosque Redondo is signed, allowing the Navajo to return to their lands in Arizona and New Mexico.
text: The Treaty of Bosque Redondo is signed, allowing the Navajo to return to their lands in Arizona and New Mexico.

title: Napoléon Eugène, the last dynastic Bonaparte, is killed in the Anglo-Zulu War.
text: Napoléon Eugène, the last dynastic Bonaparte, is killed in the Anglo-Zulu War.

title: The United States Census Bureau begins using Herman Hollerith's tabulating machine to count census returns.
text: The United States Census Bureau begins using Herman Hollerith's tabulating machine to count census returns.

title: Robert Falcon Scott's second South Pole expedition leaves Cardiff.
text: Robert Falcon Scott's second South Pole expedition leaves Cardiff.

title: The Greek–Serbian Treaty of Alliance is signed, paving the way for the Second Balkan War.
text: The Greek–Serbian Treaty of Alliance is signed, paving the way for the Second Balkan War.

title: Louis Brandeis becomes the first Jew appointed to the United States Supreme Court.
text: Louis Brandeis becomes the first Jew appointed to the United States Supreme Court.

title: World War I: Western Front: Battle of Belleau Wood: Allied Forces under John J. Pershing and James Harbord engage Imperial German Forces under Wilhelm, German Crown Prince.
text: World War I: Western Front: Battle of Belleau Wood: Allied Forces under John J. Pershing and James Harbord engage Imperial German Forces under Wilhelm, German Crown Prince.

title: The Royal Ulster Constabulary is founded.
text: The Royal Ulster Constabulary is founded.

title: The 1st Conference of the Communist Parties of Latin America is held in Buenos Aires.
text: The 1st Conference of the Communist Parties of Latin America is held in Buenos Aires.

title: First flight of the German Focke-Wulf Fw 190 fighter aircraft.
text: First flight of the German Focke-Wulf Fw 190 fighter aircraft.

title: World War II: The Battle of Crete ends as Crete capitulates to Germany.
text: World War II: The Battle of Crete ends as Crete capitulates to Germany.

title: The Farhud, a massive pogrom in Iraq, starts and as a result, many Iraqi Jews are forced to leave their homes.
text: The Farhud, a massive pogrom in Iraq, starts and as a result, many Iraqi Jews are forced to leave their homes.

title: BOAC Flight 777 is shot down over the Bay of Biscay by German Junkers Ju 88s, killing British actor Leslie Howard and leading to speculation that it was actually an attempt to kill British Prime Minister Winston Churchill.
text: BOAC Flight 777 is shot down over the Bay of Biscay by German Junkers Ju 88s, killing British actor Leslie Howard and leading to speculation that it was actually an attempt to kill British Prime Minister Winston Churchill.

title: Ion Antonescu, "Conducator" ("Leader") of Romania during World War II, is executed.
text: Ion Antonescu, "Conducator" ("Leader") of Romania during World War II, is executed.

title: Charles de Gaulle comes out of retirement to lead France by decree for six months.
text: Charles de Gaulle comes out of retirement to lead France by decree for six months.

title: The Canadian Bank of Commerce and Imperial Bank of Canada merge to form the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce, the largest bank merger in Canadian history.
text: The Canadian Bank of Commerce and Imperial Bank of Canada merge to form the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce, the largest bank merger in Canadian history.

title: Adolf Eichmann is hanged in Israel.
text: Adolf Eichmann is hanged in Israel.

title: Kenya becomes a republic with Jomo Kenyatta(1897 – 22 August 1978) as its 1st President(1964 to 1978)
text: Kenya becomes a republic with Jomo Kenyatta(1897 – 22 August 1978) as its 1st President(1964 to 1978)

title: The Beatles' Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band is released.
text: The Beatles' Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band is released.

title: The Heimlich maneuver for rescuing choking victims is published in the journal Emergency Medicine.
text: The Heimlich maneuver for rescuing choking victims is published in the journal Emergency Medicine.

title: The Patriotic Union of Kurdistan was founded by Jalal Talabani, Nawshirwan Mustafa, Fuad Masum and others.

title: The first international applications under the Patent Cooperation Treaty are filed.
text: The first international applications under the Patent Cooperation Treaty are filed.

title: The first black-led government of Rhodesia (now Zimbabwe) in 90 years takes power.
text: The first black-led government of Rhodesia (now Zimbabwe) in 90 years takes power.

title: Cable News Network (CNN) begins broadcasting.
text: Cable News Network (CNN) begins broadcasting.

title: European Central Bank is founded in Brussels.
text: European Central Bank is founded in Brussels.

title: The Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty comes into effect.
text: The Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty comes into effect.

title: Cold War: George H. W. Bush and Mikhail Gorbachev sign a treaty to end chemical weapon production.
text: Cold War: George H. W. Bush and Mikhail Gorbachev sign a treaty to end chemical weapon production.

title: Dobrinja mortar attack: Thirteen are killed and 133 wounded when Serb mortar shells are fired at a soccer game in Dobrinja, west of Sarajevo.
text: Dobrinja mortar attack: Thirteen are killed and 133 wounded when Serb mortar shells are fired at a soccer game in Dobrinja, west of Sarajevo.

title: American Airlines Flight 1420 slides and crashes while landing at Little Rock National Airport, killing 11 people on a flight from Dallas to Little Rock.
text: American Airlines Flight 1420 slides and crashes while landing at Little Rock National Airport, killing 11 people on a flight from Dallas to Little Rock.

title: Nepalese royal massacre: Crown Prince Dipendra of Nepal shoots and kills several members of his family including his father and mother.
text: Nepalese royal massacre: Crown Prince Dipendra of Nepal shoots and kills several members of his family including his father and mother.

title: Dolphinarium discotheque massacre: A Hamas suicide bomber kills 21 at a disco in Tel Aviv.
text: Dolphinarium discotheque massacre: A Hamas suicide bomber kills 21 at a disco in Tel Aviv.

title: Oklahoma state prosecutors sentence Oklahoma City bombing co-conspirator Terry Nichols to 161 consecutive life terms without the possibility of a parole breaking a Guinness World Record.
text: Oklahoma state prosecutors sentence Oklahoma City bombing co-conspirator Terry Nichols to 161 consecutive life terms without the possibility of a parole breaking a Guinness World Record.

title: Air France Flight 447 crashes into the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Brazil on a flight from Rio de Janeiro to Paris. All 228 passengers and crew are killed.
text: Air France Flight 447 crashes into the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Brazil on a flight from Rio de Janeiro to Paris. All 228 passengers and crew are killed.

title: General Motors files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. It is the fourth largest United States bankruptcy in history.
text: General Motors files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy. It is the fourth largest United States bankruptcy in history.

title: A rare tornado outbreak occurs in New England; a strong EF3 tornado strikes Springfield, Massachusetts, during the event, killing four people.
